-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NIHIL proudly presents Carcass' landmark 1991 deathgrind relase, Necroticism: 
Descanting the Insalubrious (literally, The dying process: singing about the 
unclean). Remastered in 2004 and rereleased again in 2008, this album would 
plant the seeds that would later germinate in the deathgrind genre, influencing 
notable bands such as Exhumed and Aborted. Crafting festering lead work and 
pounding, twisting rhythms into demented songs about the various uses of dead 
bodies, Owen, Steer, Amott and Walker had conceived a macabre masterpiece, one 
of the most towering landmarks in the Death Metal genre.  The rereleased version 
is notable for containing the Tools of the Trade EP, which has two rerecorded 
songs from Symphonies of Sickness. One of the most important metal albums of the 
early 90's and a must-have for any metal fan.
